SENT.plain: Five patients with acral chilblains and lupus anticoagulant activity revealed by coagulation analysis are reported
Three patients suffered a systemic lupus erythematosus, and two of them a completely developed antiphospholipid syndrome as well

Another case had chronic cutaneous lupus with only facial discoid lesions, and in the last one the lupus anticoagulant was likely related to a chronic liver infection of hepatitis B virus because she had not erythematous lupus
There are few dermatologic references about chilblain associated to lupus anticoagulant
Certain evidences suggest a pathogenic relation of this findings
